Title: US regulator grants Golden Pass LNG a three-year extension to complete construction
Description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has granted Golden Pass LNG’s request for a three-year extension to complete the construction of its 15.6 mtpa LNG export project in Sabine Pass, Texas, pushing its construction deadline to Nov. 30, 2029, and delaying the project’s start.
Author: CK

Title: First Gen’s BW Batangas FSRU leaves LNG terminal to idle after returning from repairs
Description: The 162,400 m3 BW Batangas floating storage regasification unit is currently idling off the west coast of the Philippines island of Mindoro days after returning to the First Gen-operated 5.3 mtpa LNG terminal in Batangas in the Philippines following repairs at the Subic Shipyard since mid-August.
Author: CK

Title: AG&P LNG acquires Outer Harbor LNG project developer Venice Energy
Description: Singapore-based downstream LNG infrastructure firm AG&P LNG has agreed to acquire Australian energy infrastructure firm Venice Energy, the developer of the proposed 2 mtpa Outer Harbor LNG import terminal in Port Adelaide, South Australia, and is targeting to bring the project online in the first quarter of 2027. The value of the deal was not disclosed.
Author: CK

Title: Cameron LNG receives less feed gas due to scheduled maintenance on Train 3
Description: Feed gas flows to the 13.5 mtpa Cameron LNG plant in Louisiana have dropped in recent days, reflecting a week-long scheduled maintenance at its third train this week, according to firms with offtake from the plant.
Author: CK
